Sheryl Gay Stolberg writes that the 225 attendees were survivors of an intense winnowing-down process by a White House confronted by some of toughest jockeying for invitations in recent memory. President Bush Reagan official Ralph Benko, who ran a website that urged Mr. Mike Pence to seek higher office, tells me: Mike Pence has qualities that inspired unprecedented across-the-board enthusiasm among movement conservatives. I hope that he would accept an offer of the vice presidency from the eventual Republican nominee if called. Other conservative leaders I contacted all reacted with dismay to the Mike Pence news and feared that it moves Mr. Mitt Romney one step closer to the GOP nomination.
